outline:
1. to be short, be impatient, be vexed, be grieved
    1. (Qal) to be short
    2. (Piel) to shorten
    3. (Hiphil) to shorten
  2. to reap, harvest
    1. (Qal) to reap, harvest
    2. (Hiphil) to reap, harvest
kjv_def: [idiom] at all, cut down, much discouraged, grieve, harvestman, lothe, mourn, reap(-er), (be, wax) short(-en, -er), straiten, trouble, vex.
strongs_def: to dock off, i.e. curtail (transitive or intransitive, literal or figurative); especially to harvest (grass or grain)
